meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of a monad.
meanings.sent1: The monadic concept focuses on the individual unit.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the monadic nature of the cell.
meanings.sent3: In the monadic world of atoms, each particle has its own unique identity.
meanings.sent4: Her monadic personality shone brightly in the group.
meanings.sent5: The monadic essence of the flower was captivating.

meanings.definition: Consisting of a single element or component.
meanings.sent1: The monadic structure of the molecule was simple yet powerful.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a monadic painting using only black and white.
meanings.sent3: The monadic cupcake was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: His monadic approach to design made his work stand out.
meanings.sent5: The monadic melody echoed through the empty hall.

meanings.definition: Involving or relating to a single entity or unit.
meanings.sent1: The monadic decision rested solely on his shoulders.
meanings.sent2: The monadic rule applied to all members of the team.
meanings.sent3: The monadic cat ruled the neighborhood with grace.
meanings.sent4: Her monadic presence commanded attention in the room.
meanings.sent5: The monadic star shone brightly in the night sky.
